lead_paragraph: As the offensive to retake Mosul, Iraq, from the Islamic State heats up, residents can stay and hope for the best, or flee and possibly become refugees.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Erbil, Iraq, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

headline.print_headline: Flee Their City or Stay? For Mosul Residents, Both Choices Seem Bleak
headline.main: Flee or Stay? For Mosul Residents, Both Choices Are Risky

snippet: As the offensive to retake Mosul, Iraq, from the Islamic State heats up, residents can stay and hope for the best, or flee and possibly become refugees....
abstract: Residents of Mosul, Iraq, face stark choice of whether to remain in city or flee to uncertainty as military moves to retake city from Islamic State; humanitarian aid groups and international agencies are racing clock in face of possibility that trickle of civilians fleeing Mosul now will soon turn into torrent.
